contentrichtext.text: {{other uses|Sela (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Sela' |other_name = |native_name = السلع |nickname = |settlement_type = Village <!-- images and maps -----------> |image_skyline = Sela.JPG |imagesize = 250px |image_caption = Old Sela |image_seal = |image_flag = |pushpin_map = Jordan |pushpin_label_position = |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_region = JO |subdivision_type =Country |subdivision_name = [[Jordan]] |subdivision_type1 = Province |subdivision_name1 = [[Tafilah Governorate]] |subdivision_type2 = Department |subdivision_name2 = [[Bozrah|Busaira]] Department |government_type = |leader_title = |leader_name = |established_title = Founded <!-- Settled --> |established_date = 1100 B.C. |area_magnitude = 1 E8 |area_metro_km2 = |area_metro_sq_mi = |population_as_of = |population_total = |population_metro = |population_footnotes = |timezone =[[Greenwich Mean Time|GMT]] +2 |utc_offset = |timezone_DST = +3 |latd=30 |latm=45 |lats=0.78 |latNS=N |longd=35 |longm=43 |longs=35.97 |longEW=E |area_code = +(962)3 |elevation_m = |elevation_ft = |elevation_footnotes = |website = }} '''Sela''' ({{lang-ar|السلع}}, {{lang-he|סֶּלַע}}, transliteration ''Sela‛'', meaning ''[[Rock (geology)|rock]]''; Arabic: [[as-Sala‛]]; {{lang-el|πέτρα}}; {{lang-la|petra}}) was the capital of [[Edom]], situated in the great valley extending from the [[Dead Sea]] to the [[Red Sea]] ([[2 Kings]] 14:7). It was near [[Mount Hor]], close by the [[desert]] of Zin. It is called "the rock" ([[Book of Judges|Judges]] 1:36). When [[Amaziah]] took it he called it Joktheel (also spelled '''Jokteel''' ([[Jewish Publication Society of America Version|JPS]]) and '''Jectehel''' ([[Douay–Rheims Bible|DRB]])) (q.v.) ({{lang-he|יָקְתְאֵל}}, Jiqha<u>t</u>-’Ēl, "the blessedness of God" or "subdued by God";<ref>Meanings from ''Net Bible Study Dictionary'', http://net.bible.org/dictionary.php?word=Joktheel [http://net.bible.org/dictionary.php?word=Joktheel]</ref> {{lang-la|Jectehel}}) or Kathoel ({{lang-el|Καθοηλ}}) in the [[Septuagint]]. It is mentioned by the prophets ([[Isaiah]] 15:1; 16:1; [[Obadiah]] 1:3) as doomed to destruction. Sela is identified with the ruins of Sela, east of [[Tafilah|Tafileh]] in [[Jordan]] (identified as biblical [[Tophel]]) and near [[Bozrah]], all Edomite cities in the mountains of Edom. Sela appears in later history and in the [[Vulgate]] under the name of [[Petra]]. "The [[caravan (travellers)|caravan]] of all ages, from the interior of [[Arabia]] and from the [[Persian Gulf]], from [[Hadhramaut]] on the [[ocean]], and even from Sabea ([[Sheba]]) or [[Yemen]], appear to have pointed to Petra as a common centre; and from Petra the [[tide]] seems again to have branched out in every direction, to [[Egypt]], [[Palestine]], and [[Syria]], through [[Arsinoe (Gulf of Suez)|Arsinoe]], [[Gaza]], [[Tyre, Lebanon|Tyre]], [[Jerusalem]], and [[Damascus]], and by other routes, terminating at the [[Mediterranean Sea]]."
